sentences.sContent: The fair coordinator has been given powers to expel suspected troublemakers.
sentences.sCn: 那位公正的协调员已被赋予权力，以驱逐涉嫌闹事者。

synos.tran: 捣乱者，闹事者；惹麻烦的人

words.tran: 麻烦的；讨厌的；使人苦恼的
故障检修工；解决纠纷者；解决麻烦问题的能手

trans.tranCn: 捣乱者，闹事者；惹麻烦的人
trans.tranOther: If you refer to someone as a troublemaker, you mean that they cause unpleasantness, quarrels, or fights, especially by encouraging people to oppose authority
